body:
I think this is still a problem in 0.25.4: 

Link to minimal reproduction http://bit.ly/1UpzaOC

If this is a different problem, please yell at me and I'll open a new issue.

index.js:
`export * from "./core"`
core.js:
`import * as common from "./common"; export { common };`
common.js:
`export const foo = "foo";`

generates (globals):

```
(function (exports) {
    'use strict';

    const foo = "bar"

    exports.common = null;

}((this.myBundle = this.myBundle || {})));
```

Good point @christopherthielen ‚Äì One can see [the problem exhibiting from your example, on rollupjs.org](http://rollupjs.org/#%7B%22options%22%3A%7B%22format%22%3A%22cjs%22%2C%22moduleName%22%3A%22myBundle%22%2C%22globals%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22moduleId%22%3A%22%22%7D%2C%22modules%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22main.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22export%20*%20from%20%5C%22.%2Fcore%5C%22%22%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22core.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22import%20*%20as%20common%20from%20%5C%22.%2Fcommon%5C%22%5Cnexport%20%7B%20common%20%7D%22%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22common.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22export%20const%20foo%20%3D%20%5C%22foo%5C%22%3B%22%7D%5D%7D)

issue.title: Rollup incorrectly exports null when re-exporting another file.

body:
Since this is still an issue as of 0.34, here is a temporary workaround for anyone who was caught by this like I was:

main.js:
`export * from "./middle.js";`
middle.js:
`import * as _foo from "./foo.js"; export const foo = _foo;`
foo.js:
`export const foo = "bar";`

[Online Version](http://rollupjs.org/#%7B%22options%22%3A%7B%22format%22%3A%22cjs%22%2C%22moduleName%22%3A%22myBundle%22%2C%22globals%22%3A%7B%7D%7D%2C%22modules%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22main.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22export%20*%20from%20%5C%22.%2Fmiddle.js%5C%22%22%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22middle.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22import%20*%20as%20_foo%20from%20%5C%22.%2Ffoo.js%5C%22%3B%5Cn%5Cnexport%20const%20foo%20%3D%20_foo%3B%22%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22foo.js%22%2C%22code%22%3A%22export%20const%20foo%20%3D%20%5C%22bar%5C%22%3B%22%7D%5D%7D)

As far as I can tell this is [fixed in recent versions](http://rollupjs.org/?version=0.37.0&) ‚Äì I remember us fixing something similar, so that all makes sense. Will close this (again! üòÄ )
